oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Copy of Civil War letter from Vicksburg
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Confederate Pvt. Elijah Hall, D Co., 16th Cav. writes from besieged Vicksburg of the exorbitant prices of local food and that items are so expensive a private "can't buy anything to eat." He goes on to talk about the only fighting near him has been with Yankee gunboats near the mouth of the Red River.
